title.value: Consumption structure of mineral components of nutrient solution by black currant regenerant plants under in vitro cultivating
Структура потребления растениями-регенерантами смородины чёрной минеральных компонентов питательных сред при культивировании in vitro

person.name: Kolbanova, E.V., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Potato, Vegetable and Fruit Growing (Belarus). Institute for Fruit Growing
Poleshko, G.D., National Academy of Sciences, Minsk (Belarus). Institute of Physical Organic Chemistry

abstract.value: Consumption of mineral components of nutrient solutions by black currant (Ribes nigrum) regenerant plants in in-vitro culture was established in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus. At a micro reproduction stage essential decrease in concentration of the majority of ions in nutrient solution was noted: maximum for NH4+ (80,11 – 87,17% from initial quantity in the solution), quantity K+ and Mg2+ decreases by 1/3 part. A little bit less is consumed by micro plants Ca2+ (15,62% – 21,09%). The difference in anion absorption from a nutrient solution is also noted. Ions H2P04- (58,48 – 62,28%) and N03- (56,75% – 62,2%) and by 1/3 Cl- and SO4**2- ones were used to the maximum extent possible. Black currant regenerant plants maximum absorb H2P04-(on the average 88,5%) from a nutrient solution at the rooting stage. Nitrogen takes up well both in nitrate (up to 64,37 %) and ammonium (up to 76,88 %) forms. Ion SO4**2- absorption makes more than 1/2 from initial quantity in the solution. At a rhisogenes stage relative consumption of ammonium nitrogen, potassium and chlorine decreases.  At the same time magnesium, calcium, sulphur and phosphorus consumption increases in comparison with a micro reproduction stage.
